com.google.crypto.tink.hybrid.internal

Class X25519HpkeKem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.crypto.tink.hybrid.internal.X25519HpkeKem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HpkeKem

    @Immutable
public final class X25519HpkeKem
extends Object
implements HpkeKem
    Diffie-Hellman-based X25519-HKDF HPKE KEM variant.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      X25519HpkeKem(HkdfHpkeKdf hkdf)
      Construct X25519-HKDF HPKE KEM using hkdf.

      Extracts the shared secret from encapsulatedKey using recipientPrivateKey.
      HpkeKemEncapOutput encapsulate(byte[] recipientPublicKey)
      Generates and encapsulates a shared secret using the recipientPublicKey.
      byte[] getKemId()
      Returns the HPKE KEM algorithm identifier for the underlying KEM implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • encapsulate

        public HpkeKemEncapOutput encapsulate(byte[] recipientPublicKey)
                               throws GeneralSecurityException
        Description copied from interface: HpkeKem
        Generates and encapsulates a shared secret using the recipientPublicKey. Returns a HpkeKemEncapOutput object that contains the raw shared secret and the encapsulated key. The HPKE I.-D. refers to this method as Encap(), which is used by the sender.
        Specified by:
        encapsulate in interface HpkeKem
        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException - when either the shared secret cannot be generated or the shared secret cannot be encapsulated.

      • decapsulate

        public byte[] decapsulate(byte[] encapsulatedKey,
                          byte[] recipientPrivateKey)
                   throws GeneralSecurityException
        Description copied from interface: HpkeKem
        Extracts the shared secret from encapsulatedKey using recipientPrivateKey. Returns the raw shared secret. The HPKE I.-D. refers to this method as Decap(), which is used by the recipient.
        Specified by:
        decapsulate in interface HpkeKem
        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException - if the shared secret cannot be extracted.

      • getKemId

        public byte[] getKemId()
                throws GeneralSecurityException
        Description copied from interface: HpkeKem
        Returns the HPKE KEM algorithm identifier for the underlying KEM implementation.

        More details at https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-irtf-cfrg-hpke-12.html#name-key-encapsulation-mechanism.

        Specified by:
        getKemId in interface HpkeKem
        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException
